Description: Body fragment of North Ionian Wild Goat style pottery bowl; inside glazed with one added red band lined in white preserved; exterior: minor trace of upper frieze; band with added red band lined in white; frieze of goats grazing to left, rear of one to left, foreparts of that to right; varied filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.108)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p.4, pl.3, 16)
